text: Golden-amber, dark. Really rich aroma like macadamia honey. Deep plummy fruit along with Turkish dried apricots ...great balance of richness and acidity. Amazing character.

Corked bottle, vintage 2011, 11% ABVSkewed Refractometer Reading: 26°BAmber color, pouring oily. Wow, this has a unique and very strong aroma and flavor of apricots and candied fruits; its sweet and syrupy, although some astringency and aciity in the final contributes to the balance.Original and excellent.
Bottle - Nice cooked apple and skin. Clear gold. Sweet and nice fruity apple sweetness and a decent finish. Touch of bitterness. Solid.

375mL bottle, pours a clear bronze / orange with no head. Aroma brings out loads of fresh apricots, followed by toffee and caramelized apples. Flavour is huge on the apricots -- surprising that there arent any in this -- fresh apricots, treacle toffee and baked apple pie. Lots of residual sugar, but never makes it unpalatable. Complex, apricot-dominant and harmonious. Awesome.

Bottle shared by Frank or Ryan. Cheers. Pours vibrant copper with no head really. Aroma is very inviting with strawberry jam, apple skins, caramel, and spicy wood. Flavor is just as awesome with apple juice, caramel sugar, and light spice. Velvety mouth feel with tons of warming in the chest.

Sample from 2008 vintage.
Pours very dark amber with no head. Not so many legs. Aroma is of apples, vanilla, oak, some faint hints of slight notes reminiscent of coconut. Taste is of awesome apples, sugar, some acidity, alcohol. Palate: Full bodied. Sweet. No carbonation. Overall: Awesome apples. Amongst the best Ive ever had.

2008 vintage. Pours a clear copper with good legs. Nose is of cooked apples and not too sugary. Light apple pie reminescence. Taste is of the usual apples and brown sugar but there is something different in the acid profile. Not sure if it is because of the aging or if it was like that when it was first released. Anyhow, good and not too sweet. Body is full and mouthfeel is lightly "sandy" (for lack of a better word, filled with small sugar particles is what I mean) and sticky. Another nice dessert drink by Vergers Lafrance!

2oz sample from bottle, 2008 vintage. Clear deep chestnut pour light legs. Super aromatic, tons of dried plums, old apple, apple-peach butter, raisins, figs. Taste is rich, decadent, candied fruit galore, brandy soaked dried plums, overripe apple. Palate is sticky, med full bodied with long lingering finish. Slight extreme in its tendency towards old brandy soaked fruit but oh so decadent and tasty.

sample from tom10101, thanks bro! clear dark amber, orange tint pour, bright. very spicy apples, cinnamon sticks, baked and buttered caramelized apples, fire cider-like, i.e. heat concentrated features; lots of brown sugar, peppery and spicy strawberries, sweet beet roots, raisins, dark wild honey attributes, touch of acidity - lacking a little, phenolic traces. flat carbonation, medium-full body - syrupy; sweet and very spicy finish. wasnt quite digging the aroma with its vegetal-phenolic-off-yeasty character but it is an overall opulent, spicy, rich and tasty ice cider.

2 oz sample from bottle (375 ml). 2008 harvest.

Appearance: Deep copper with nice legs. 

Aroma: Brown sugar, baked apples, cinnamon, tropical fruits, wood and caramelized apples.

Taste: Medium sweetness and moderate acidity. Baked and caramelized apples with tropical fruits, brown sugar warming spices, vanilla notes and light alcohol.

Palate: Medium to full body. Thick and syrupy. Mild spiciness and some warming alcohol in the finish. 

Overall: One of the most complex Ice Cider out there. Nice baked and caramelized apples presence. Could use a bit more acidity. Really tasty.

Bottle @ Mondial des Cidres de Glace 2015. Almost amber colored with some nice legs. Wowe, what a nose on this. Tropical fruit, pears, and juicy, fresh apples. Great acidity on the tongue as well as a very nice sweetness. Semi-tart but also sweet pears. Lots of apple, some pineapple juice, citrus, and baked apples. Damn, son.

Bottle sampled at Mondial 2014 with Linh, Minh and Angela. Pours a deep amber body. Aroma is sweet apple, rich honey, fruit and a nice maple character coming through. Mouthfeel is full and rich with the maple character taking center stage. Additional notes of rich apple pie, honey, apple sugar, honey and oak.
Golden orange body. Intense sweet, ripe apples. Light spicing. Clean profile. Moderate acidity and lively sweetness. Straightforward but rich.

Sample, bottle, tasted during the Mondial des cidres de glace, savoured on February 8 2013; eye: coppery, rich, clear, no effervescence; nose: lychee, nuts, candied apple, pear; mouth: lychee, nuts, candied apple, pear, finale in lychee with presence of apple, medium body, mildly sweet, palateful texture; overall: very good
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Échantillon, bouteille, bue lors du Mondial des cidres de glace, savourée le 8 février 2013; il : cuivrée, riche, limpide, pas deffervescence; nez : litchi, noix, pomme confite, poire; bouche : litchi, noix, pomme confite, poire, finale en litchi avec présence de pomme, corps moyen, moyennement sucré, texture moelleuse; en résumé : très bon

[3898-20110820] 200mL bottle. Sweet musty applesauce aroma has a touch of lychee. Clear, brown orange body with no head. Thick sugary apple flesh flavour has almost an underlying brûlée-like base. Medium body is thick and sweet. Delicious, surprising for a Saturday morning. (8/3/8/4/16) 3.9
(w/ jerc, rudolf)

2011-08-19. Crisp dark syrupy golden body. Pleasant aroma, rich notes of caramelized apple, baked apple notes, very mild notes of apple skins. 8+ Flavour is similar with lots of apple, some tannic notes, quite sweet overall but with enough acidity to balance it. Smooth medium to full bodied palate. 4+ Very nice cider.  2007 Vintage Bottle from SAQ, Montreal

Bottle shared by Jercraigs & Mabel - thanks!  Beautiful clear gold.  Nose is apples & pears, some cinnamon, alcohol.  Flavor is sweet honeyed apples, very nice tartness balancing the sweetness, alcohol.  Honey character becomes stronger in the finish, with some nice alcoholic warmth.

375 ml clear corked bottle shared by beastiefan2k with an assist to Artem and Boris. Pour is brilliant golden, still, with syrupy legs. Aroma is soft apple, warming sugar, and a spice that reminded me a bit of apple pie. Taste is super smooth apple, lightly tart, the sugar is less pronounced in the taste, and certainly less sweet - a bit more of a floral nature.  Its sweet, to be sure, but far from cloying.  Palate is silky, medium bodied, pleasantly mouth coating and lightly floral tart finish.  Nice one, thanks Eugene and friends!

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2011 375ml bottle. Aroma is all sweet apple but easy sweet, tart apple sweet.  Flavor is sweet yet easy and natural.  Tart sweet apples coat the throat.  Nice and lovely beverage.  Thanks to my buddies for getting this for me.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text:
Sample at Mondial du Cidre de glace 2011.
Aroma : Light exotic fruits and light overcooked caramel. Nice cooked apple skin.

Taste : Very nice fruits and very nice overcooked apples. Finish great dry pinneaples. Awesome finish. Lots and lots of exotic fruits.

Overall : Intense but very tasty tropical fruits all around. Better than the Leduc Piedimonte Regular.

Pouring at Le Mondial des Cidres Glaces.  Pours a clear golden yellow.  Bright candy and light oak and acid.  Candy sweet and tart, but slowly developing.  Big and sweet, but theres definitely something odd that took me a while to place. Finally figured out, the aftertaste tastes like Nerds candies.

375mL thanks to ygtbsm94 via Gloublouburp. Two of my favorite people obviously have good taste in ice cider. I may be a sucker for ice cider, but damn this was good. Pour is clear, deep orange gold with big legs everywhere on the glass. Aroma is simply unreal: so much robust apple character. Jonagold and Honeycrisp apples explode with both tartness and immense fresh sweetness. There is actually a baked green apple element here from the freezing process. The nose really is like pure nectar. The taste is on par with wild nectar qualities: sweet honey, ambrosia, baked fresh apples, tart apple medley. Palate is pure honey viscosity, wildly thick. Heaven in a glass. Just too good to be true.

Pours amber with no carbonation and no neck on the glass.  Smells of carmelized apples, syrup, boozy.  Tastes very sweet with some cough syrup elements.  Too intense to be enjoyable for more than a few sips.

Bouteille verte de 375 ml, avec bouchon de liège, achetée au Mondial des Cidres de Glace du Québec 2008 (Rougemont, QC). Arôme: Odeur de pommes confites avec une pointe de caramel. Apparence: La couleur est dorée. Saveur: Goût de pommes confites avec une pointe de miel et d’érable. Durée moyenne de l’arrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture liquoreuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Légère présence d’érable en arrière goût. (Rating #1967)

Caramelised apples and brown sugar in the nose complemented by light touches of alcohol.  Clear, deep copper-honey-golden coloured body with no legs on the glass.  Brown sugar and honeyed apples with some hints of spice in the very sweet, almost cloying flavour.  Syrupy, sticky, thick texture is rich and velvety.  Mild alcohol warming.  Enjoyable in small quantities but has a tendency to build quickly.  Bottle sampled at the post-Mondial 2006 tasting.

Post-Mondial tasting at Goldoraks pad, from 375 ml bottle.   Pours a deep whisky-amber color with thick slow-falling legs in the glass....very sweet, fresh apple nose with hints of maple, thick and flowery....near-cloying mouthfeel just stops short of syrupiness, sweet apples and long-simmered applesauce with hints of cinnamon and raisin....at the finish a nice sour-tart hint makes for a bit more complexity, though the touch of iron doesnt really help matters.  Not one of my favorite ice ciders but perfectly drinkable (though probably not worth the price).

The sweetest of their 3 ice ciders, propelling a honeyed apple aroma onto salivating nostrils...Rich mouthfeel full of apple pie filling, caramel, and honey...As good as their other ice ciders, but for double the price (45$ vs. 24$ for the others), this isnt worth the extra money...But its certainly worth a few tastes...

Still and dark gold. A vinous apple nose that shows the pleasant pear and mango nuances that the most concentrated examples often display. Not so thick as a Face cachée de la Pomme, but the cloying character is nicely coated by a charming acidity that seems natural in its fruitiness and eases up the drinkability. Body is honeyed perhaps more than maple-like and aromatic with good concentration. Mature and very enjoyable offering. Thanks for sharing Alain.

Rating 2000! Yahoo! Dark golden cider with almost scotch like qualities. Complex apple and brandy in aroma, with candy floos notes. More complex in  mouth than Domaine Lafrance, with cooked apple sauce, maple and a bit of woodyness.  Smooth alcohol wafting through. Mmmmm... me likes Cidre de Glace! At Salon des Vins et Spiritueux de Montréal, March 25 2006.

Bu au Salon du vin de Montréal 06. Un viritable jus de pomme alcoolisé. Couleur plus foncé que la plus par des cidres glacés. Très bon goût de jus de pomme frais et sucré qui ne tombe pas sur le coeur.
